definition: to return in triumph/to return victorious

sentences.english: The legionaries, on their victorious return, refused any longer to obey the consuls.
sentences.chinese: 军团士兵在凯旋归国时，不肯服从执政官的命令。

sentences.english: Only applicants of 18 years of ages or older are eligible for membership of L'Arc card.
sentences.chinese: 年满18岁或以上之人仕方可申请成为凯旋会卡会员。
高举闪着凯旋的宝剑刀锋。

sentences.english: He is a victorious commander returning from the arena of war.
sentences.chinese: 他是从战场凯旋归来的司令。

sentences.english: And the great Church victorious shall be the church at rest.
sentences.chinese: 到时凯旋的教会，得享永憩无疆。

sentences.english: They greet her with a smile, like the Arc de Triomphe to welcome the return of the hero.
sentences.chinese: 他们笑着迎她，像迎接凯旋归来的英雄。

sentences.english: Medical teams of Wanli Group returned in triumph from Wenchuan earthquake-stricken area thousands of mils far.
sentences.chinese: 派遣至汶川地震灾区的万里医疗队凯旋归来。

sentences.english: They built a triumphal arch to memorialize their victory.
sentences.chinese: 他们建了凯旋门来纪念胜利。

sentences.english: Both 10- and 25-player versions will drop Emblems of Triumph as well.
sentences.chinese: 不管是10人还是25人版本都将掉落凯旋纹章。

sentences.english: Thee centre of Paris, the Arch of Triumph, rays out into twelve busy streets.
sentences.chinese: 从巴黎市中心凯旋门延伸出十二条繁华的大街。

sentences.english: Many of China's triumphs went beyond excellence.
sentences.chinese: 很多中国运动员的凯旋不仅仅应该用优秀来形容。

sentences.english: After the triumphant return, can again unscarred?
sentences.chinese: 而凯旋归来后，是否可以别来无恙？

sentences.english: Located only a short walk from Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe.
sentences.chinese: 仅需简短步行即可到达香榭大道和凯旋门。

sentences.english: I was so happy Father was homeagain.
sentences.chinese: 我也为爸爸胜利凯旋而高兴。

sentences.english: The festival also celebrates the return of a king of an old story.
sentences.chinese: 这种节日也会庆祝古代故事里的国王凯旋归来。

definition: to withdraw troops from the front/to return in triumph
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
(in former times) upper, middle and lower army/army of right, center and left/(in modern times) the three armed services: Army, Navy and Air Force
an expedition, esp. military/march to remote regions
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
report of success/report of a victory
to win/to be victorious/to report a victory
to recover (territory or power)/the liberation of Taiwan from Japanese rule in 1945
Guangfu or Kuangfu township in Hualien County 花蓮縣|花莲县[Hua1 lian2 Xian4], east Taiwan
